explains: adj. 可归因于……的；可能出自……的

sentences.en: Their illnesses are attributable to a poor diet.
sentences.cn: 他们的病可能是不良饮食所致。

sentences.en: 10,000 deaths a year from chronic lung disease are attributable to smoking.
sentences.cn: 每年1万个慢性肺病患者的死亡可能是由于吸烟导致的。

sentences.en: The rise of the Elizabethans two centuries later was attributable to the widespread use of sheep manure.
sentences.cn: 两个世纪后，伊丽莎白时代的兴起要归功于羊粪的广泛使用。
